metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5370 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
JRuby computes hash values without properly restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table, as demonstrated by a universal multicollision attack against the MurmurHash2 algorithm, a different vulnerability than CVE-2011-4838.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5370` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 1.5.6-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jruby package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.6-5').
